reasoning: Accessory spleen is a common anatomical variant found in ~0.2-0.7% of population at autopsy or imaging, but not a disease requiring clinical intervention. Prevalence-based estimate: 0.2-0.7% = 2,000-7,000 per 100k population. Using midpoint ~5,000 per 100k. Moderate confidence as this is incidental finding, not disease incidence.
